alert.note: Alert for Shelby (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Memphis (Western Tennessee, Eastern Arkansas and Northern Mississippi)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued January 01 at 12:40PM CST until January 01 at 6:00PM CST by NWS Memphis
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 345 PM CST THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of North Mississippi and West Tennessee, including the following counties, in North Mississippi, DeSoto. In West Tennessee, Shelby. * WHEN...Until 345 PM CST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1240 PM CST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. Between 0.5 and 1 inch of rain has fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Southaven, Germantown, Olive Branch, Horn Lake, Hernando, Memphis, Walls, Whitehaven, Lynchburg, Southeast Memphis, Eudora, Lake Cormorant, Alden, Jago, Plum Point, Nesbit, Twin Lakes, West Days, Capleville and Lake View. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
